description.plain:
M83 is a French electronic/shoegaze/pop band from Antibes, formed in 2001 by Anthony Gonzalez and Nicolas Fromageau. Gonzalez remains the primary member of the band after Fromageau’s departure after the release of their second album. The band is named after the spiral galaxy Messier 83, and its musical aesthetic is influenced by shoegaze in its extensive use of reverb effects and lyrics spoken softly over loud instrumentals, although M83’s songs employ considerably less guitar than most shoegaze bands.

After the release of the crossover smash hit “Midnight City” from their 2011 double album Hurry Up, We’re Dreaming, M83 gained massive mainstream recognition, and has continued to tour and make music for movies and television.

body.plain:

Gonzalez remains the primary member of the band after Fromageau’s departure after the release of their second album. The band is named after the spiral galaxy Messier 83, and its musical aesthetic is influenced by shoegaze in its extensive use of reverb effects and lyrics spoken softly over loud instrumentals, although M83’s songs employ considerably less guitar than most shoegaze bands.

After the release of the crossover smash hit “Midnight City” from their 2011 double album Hurry Up, We’re Dreaming, M83 gained massive mainstream recognition, and has continued to tour and make music for movies and television.

songs.title: Wait

description.plain:
“Wait” is the fifth track off of M83’s Hurry Up, We’re Dreaming.

It deals with moving on in life. There’s no time to waste crying or stressing about things that didn’t work out.

The song has been featured in many different shows and films, like The Fault in Our Stars, Five Feet Apart, The Vampire Diaries, and Under the Dome.

Facing tempests of dust, I'll fight until the end
Creatures of my dreams raise up and dance with me!
Now and forever, I'm your king!

songs.title: Midnight City

description.plain:
“Midnight City” is off of M83’s sixth, and critically acclaimed album Hurry Up, We’re Dreaming (Naive, 2011). The song’s catchiness quickly made it one of the most popular songs of the year, appearing on the top of many “Best of” lists. The song is a tribute to city life and the city itself, especially how it comes alive during the nighttime.

Anthony Gonzalez’s comment on the use of the saxophone:

Sometimes a song needs an element to be finished. You know that this element has been overused in the past and is considered clichéd or cheesy, but the song needs it. With this album, the whole idea was to do something and have no regrets.

The music video is a tribute to the movies Village of the Damned and Close Encounters of the Third Kind.

songs.embed_content: Read “Midnight City” by M83 on Genius

songs.lyrics:
71 ContributorsTranslationsEspañolFrançaisMidnight City Lyrics[Instrumental Intro]

[Verse 1]
Waiting in the car
Waiting for a ride in the dark
At night the city grows
Look at the horizon glow

[Instrumental Bridge]

[Verse 2]
Waiting in the car
Waiting for a ride in the dark
Drinking in the lights
Following the neon signs
Waiting for a word (Word)
Looking at the milky skyline (Skyline)
The city is my church (The city is my church)
It wraps me in its blinding twilight (Twilight)
[Instrumental Bridge]

[Outro]
Waiting in the car
Waiting for the ride in the dark
Waiting in the car (Waiting in the car)
Waiting for the ride in the dark (Ride in the dark)
Waiting in the car (Car)
Waiting for the ride in the dark
Waiting in the car (Waiting in the car)
Waiting for the ride in the dark
Waiting in the car (Waiting in the car)
Waiting for the ride in the dark
